title: Theories of Motivation
description:
Motivation drives human behavior.

Key Theories: Maslow’s Hierarchy of Needs, Self-Determination Theory (SDT), Expectancy Theory.
Maslow's Levels: Physiological, Safety, Love/Belonging, Esteem, Self-Actualization.

Do you know what motivates you the most: rewards, personal growth, or social connections?

title: Intrinsic vs. Extrinsic Motivation
description:
Why do we do what we do?

Intrinsic: Driven by internal satisfaction (e.g., learning for fun).
Extrinsic: Motivated by external rewards (e.g., salary, grades).

Do you feel more motivated when working for personal growth or external rewards?

title: Cognitive Dissonance
description:
The discomfort of holding conflicting beliefs or behaviors.

Example: A person values health but smokes.
People resolve dissonance by changing beliefs, behaviors, or rationalizing.

Can you recall a time when you felt cognitive dissonance? How did you resolve it?

title: The Power of Habits
description:
Habits shape who we are.

Habit Loop: Cue → Routine → Reward.
Breaking bad habits: Identify triggers and replace routines.

What’s one habit you’d like to build or break?

title: Growth vs. Fixed Mindset
description:
Your mindset shapes your success.

Growth Mindset: Intelligence and abilities can develop.
Fixed Mindset: Intelligence and abilities are static.

How do you react to failure: as a setback or a learning opportunity?

title: Delayed Gratification
description:
Resisting immediate rewards for long-term gains.

The Marshmallow Test: Kids who resisted eating a marshmallow immediately had better life outcomes.
Key for success: Patience, self-control, and future focus.

Do you prioritize instant pleasure or long-term rewards?

title: The Dopamine Reward System
description:
Why does achieving goals feel good?

Dopamine is released when we anticipate rewards.
Social media, gambling, and video games exploit this.

How do you manage your dopamine-driven habits?

title: The Psychology of Procrastination
description:
Why do we delay tasks?

Causes: Fear of failure, lack of motivation, instant gratification.
Solutions: The 5-Minute Rule, Pomodoro Technique, Habit Stacking.

What’s your biggest procrastination trigger?

title: Decision Fatigue
description:
Too many choices drain mental energy.

Causes: Constant decision-making depletes willpower.
Solutions: Routines, automating small choices, prioritization.

Do you notice feeling tired after making many decisions?

title: The Influence of Social Norms
description:
Humans conform to societal expectations.

Example: The Asch Conformity Experiment.
Peer pressure affects decisions, sometimes subconsciously.

When have you felt influenced by social norms?

title: The Role of Emotions in Decision-Making
description:
We think we are logical, but emotions drive many decisions.

The Somatic Marker Hypothesis: Emotions guide choices.
Example: Impulse buying due to excitement.

Have you ever made a big decision based purely on emotion?

title: The Psychology of Persuasion
description:
How do people influence others?

Robert Cialdini’s 6 Principles: Reciprocity, Scarcity, Authority, Commitment, Liking, Social Proof.
Used in marketing, leadership, and negotiations.

Can you recall a time when persuasion worked on you?

title: The Fundamental Attribution Error
description:
We judge others differently than ourselves.

We blame others’ mistakes on personality but ours on circumstances.
Example: Someone cuts you off in traffic (they’re rude), but when you do it, you were in a rush.

Have you ever misjudged someone based on their actions?

title: The Power of Gratitude
description:
Gratitude improves well-being and motivation.

Benefits: Increases happiness, reduces stress, improves relationships.
Practice: Keep a gratitude journal.

What’s something you’re grateful for today?

title: The Halo Effect
description:
First impressions matter.

People judge others based on one outstanding trait.
Example: Assuming an attractive person is also intelligent.

Have you ever been affected by the Halo Effect?

title: The Self-Fulfilling Prophecy
description:
Expectations shape reality.

If you expect success, you work toward it; if you expect failure, you unconsciously sabotage yourself.
Used in education and leadership.

How do your expectations affect your outcomes?

title: Fear of Missing Out (FOMO)
description:
Why do we check social media constantly?

The brain craves inclusion and novelty.
Solution: Mindfulness, digital detox, prioritizing personal goals.

Do you ever feel FOMO? How do you handle it?

title: The Psychology of Happiness
description:
What really makes people happy?

Factors: Purpose, social connections, gratitude, experiences over things.
The Hedonic Treadmill: We adapt quickly to happiness sources.

What’s one thing that consistently makes you happy?

title: Impostor Syndrome
description:
Feeling like a fraud despite achievements.

Common among high achievers.
Solution: Acknowledge feelings, track accomplishments, seek mentorship.

Have you ever experienced Impostor Syndrome?

title: The Peak-End Rule
description:
We remember experiences based on their peak moments and ending.

Example: A vacation is remembered based on the best and last parts, not the entire trip.
Used in customer experience and memory formation.

What’s an experience you recall mostly for its ending?
